title: Man Utd fans slam Harry Maguire for his message after AZ Alkmaar draw
text:
Harry Maguire has upset Manchester United fans with his post on Twitter (AMA/Getty Images)

Harry Maguire has angered Manchester United fans for his message to supporters following the team’s drab goalless draw against AZ Alkmaar in the Europa League.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s side failed to register a shot on target as they were held to a stalemate by the Dutch side on Thursday evening.

Maguire was rested for the match as Solskjaer made several changes to his side following the 1-1 draw with Arsenal on MOnday.

After the match, Solskjaer says he was ‘pleased’ with his side’s performance and claimed there were ‘big pluses’ to take from the result.

Maguire also appeared to be buoyed by the draw as he posted on Twitter: ‘A point away from home. Thanks for the support. See you Sunday @ManUtd’.

Maguire’s message to Manchester United fans (Twitter)

But Maguire’s message was met with widespread derision from United supporters.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And fans from rival clubs also took it as an opportunity to launch a dig at the United defender.

Manchester United fans were angry with Maguire’s message (Twitter)

Meanwhile, Solskjaer is hopeful that United’s luck will improve after pointing out that two penalty decisions have gone against his side this week.

‘I just couldn’t believe what I saw,’ said Solskjaer.

‘Same as [the game against] Arsenal. You know, the handball, when it should have been 2-0.

‘It’s just frustrating for us now, not getting these little things because the boys deserved so much more and that’s what I feel for them.

‘It’s going to turn at one point, they’ll get those decisions and then they’ll get the results they deserve.’
